channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023110467
item.description:
Report X-2023110467

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unload process of a trailer and a manager was notified and package was put into a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: One of the inner containers had a loose cap and that caused the contents to leak damaging the outer package. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was taken out of the trailer and into a lined hazmat tote and given to QA for processing.

item.title: Report E-2023110103
item.description:
Report E-2023110103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During container loading into a 3rd party trailer, a drum was punctured by a protruding nail head on the pallet. The leak was immediately noticed and pallet was removed from trailer. Leaking drum was placed on a secondary containment at the dock. Product loss was less than 2 gallons, predominately into the containment. Absorbent was immediately placed on the spilled material and recovered.

item.title: Report E-2023110485
item.description:
Report E-2023110485

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The spill consisted of (2) 275 gallon metal totes containing Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 (UN1993), which released from the top of both totes due to improper packaging on the totes. The terminal stated the lids on both totes were not sufficiently sealed properly, causing approximately 10 ounces combined to slosh out from both totes during transit. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spilled amount with Oil Dri and placed the contents into a 5 gallon poly drum. The terminal tightened the lids on both totes and moved them on to the consignee. The 5Gal poly drum of waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110250
item.description:
Report E-2023110250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading a truck at Veolia's facility in Phoenix, AZ, it was discovered that a pallet of large lead acid batteries (6 batteries on the pallet) had tipped onto their side during transportation, spilling acid into the trailer. About 2 quarts of acid spilled. Spillage was from the top vents of the batteries. The trailer and dock were swept clean and washed with water and sodium bicarbonate to clean up residual acid.

item.title: Report X-2023110194
item.description:
Report X-2023110194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023110194 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED. 2. X-2023110195 UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE LEAKER WAS LEAKING OUT FROM THE CARTON IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET AND USED APPROPRIATE PPE TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND PLACE IT IN A SPILL TRAY. TAKEN TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESS. PACKAGE HAD 4 GALLONS 2 HAD LOOSE CAPS AND THE DAMAGED THE OUTER CAROTN AND OTHER GALLONS. ALL THE PRODUCT IS BEING DISPOSE OF THRU THE DMP

item.title: Report X-2023110145
item.description:
Report X-2023110145

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded, and one of the two jerry cans inside leaked due to a loose cap. DescribePack: Area inside and outside of box surrounding the cap of the one damaged jerry can is soiled, stained, and starting to rip open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat tote and given to QA for handling.
